description: The FHS segment is used to head a file (group of batches) as defined in Section 2.9.3.

fields.name: File Field Separator
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: File Encoding Characters
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: File Sending Application
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: File Sending Facility
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: File Receiving Application
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: File Receiving Facility
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: File Creation Date / Time
fields.description: field has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: File Security
fields.description: has the same definition as the corresponding field in the MSH segment

fields.name: File Name / Id
fields.description: can be used by the application processing file.  Its use is not further specified

fields.name: File Header Comment
fields.description: free text field, the use of which is not further specified

fields.name: File Control Id
fields.description: used to identify a particular file uniquely.  It can be echoed back in FHS-12-reference file control ID

fields.name: Reference File Control Id
fields.description: value of FHS-11-file control ID when this file was originally transmitted.  Not present if this file is being transmitted for the first time
